intro: Crocus vallicola var. zoharbii, commonly known as the Zohar's crocus, is a rare and delicate bulbous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet to blue flowers with a distinctive yellow center. The plant typically blooms in early spring, producing small, cup-shaped flowers that are often adorned with intricate patterns. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a challenging but rewarding addition to specialized gardens. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
